author: Sam Amick
description: The Warriors ran away with this one from the opening tip, as the Spurs clearly missed their two-way superstar Kawhi Leonard on both ends of the floor.
title: Warriors rout Kawhi Leonard-less Spurs by 36 points, take 2-0 series lead

author:
Andre Vergara                    

                                    
                        @DreDay613
title: Only one San Antonio Spurs player shows up in Game 2 beatdown by Golden State Warriors

author: Sam Amick
description: Without Kawhi Leonard, the Spurs didn't have much of a chance and were routed accordingly.
title: Warriors vs. Spurs: Five takeaways from Game 2

author: Michael C. WrightESPN Staff Writer
description: Spurs coach Gregg Popovich said Kawhi Leonard will likely miss Game 2 of the Western Conference finals and called out Warriors center Zaza Pachulia for his 'dangerous' and 'unsportsmanlike' play.
title: Leonard likely out for Game 2; Pop rips Zaza

author: JANIE McCAULEY
description: OAKLAND, Calif. (AP) — Still unbeaten, the Golden State Warriors have a few days to heal up again. Gregg Popovich's time will be spent working to get his San Antonio Spurs to wake up, before it's too late. And determine whether injured superstar Kawhi Leonard might be healthy enough to return from an ankle injury, too. Sure, the Warriors just pulled off a 36-point thrashing of the Spurs two days after squeaking out a 113-111 victory in Game 1 of the Western Conference finals — their second-largest postseason win behind a game from 1948 when the Philadelphia Warriors won by 39 at St. Louis.
title: Warriors, Spurs will try to use break to rest and heal again
